result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity:Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:36 PM Defendant Everett J. Wescott in court by video in custody with attorney Lane Fitzgerald by video.  David Zarwell and Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.   Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by court, jury trial to be set.

Victim has requested to be notified of all proceedings.
Victim has requested to be present at sentencing hearing.

Activity: Preliminary Hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:30 AM Defendant Everett J. Wescott in court in custody by video with attorney Lane Fitzgerald by video.  Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Tala Marie Cornell sworn in and testified. Witness identifed Defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects without argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
